com.atakmap.android.maps

Class MapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • AtakMapView
      • com.atakmap.android.maps.MapView

  • public class MapView
extends AtakMapView
    The content view for a MapActivity

    Responsible for dispatched MapEvents:

    • MapEvent.MAP_MOVED when the position, zoom, or focus changes

      • getPrecisePoint

        @Deprecated
public GeoPointMetaData getPrecisePoint(GeoPointMetaData geoPoint)
        Deprecated. Will be removed without replacement
        Returns a precise point, derived from the underlying imagery, based on the specified point as projected into the current view.
        Parameters:
        geoPoint - A coordinate
        Returns:
        A precise coordinate, possibly containing CE/LE and elevation information that is derived from the underlying imagery.

      • getRasterLayerAt2

        public RasterLayer2 getRasterLayerAt2(GeoPoint point)

      • getDeviceCallsign

        public java.lang.String getDeviceCallsign()
        Retreives the device callsign. This may be different than the callsign stored in shared preferences if the device is making use of the wave relay callsign that is being passed to it via callsign mocking. Callsign mocking is considered to be temporary and when the callsign is no longer being mocked, the device will revert back to the callsign set in shared preferences. If you would like to know the shared preference version of the callsign, please use the key "locationCallsign" to query the saved preference value.
        Returns:
        the current callsign based on a combination of the shared preference and the validitity of the mocking state.

      • getDeviceUid

        public static java.lang.String getDeviceUid()
        Returns the device uid which is exactly the same as the self markers uid.

      • setDeviceCallsign

        public void setDeviceCallsign(java.lang.String callsign)
        Used to set the transient value of the device callsign and does not effect the default user callsign between system restarts. To change the device callsign please make use of the shared preference key "locationCallsign".
        Parameters:
        callsign - the transient state of the device callsign which does not persist.

      • setComponentExtra

        public void setComponentExtra(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.Object extra)
        Set arbitrary data from a MapComponent. This makes the data available to other MapComponents. This is useful for loosely coupling MapComponents.
        Parameters:
        name - a unique name for the extra data Object
        extra - the extra data Object

      • getComponentExtra

        public java.lang.Object getComponentExtra(java.lang.String name)
        Get arbitrary data set by a MapComponent. This allows for dynamic coupling of MapComponents.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the extra Object
        Returns:
        an extra related to the component

      • getMapData

        public MapData getMapData()
        Obtain data associated with the map that is not defined by any other MapView getters and setters.
        Returns:
        MapData a bundle like structure of name value pairs.

      • inverseWithElevation

        @Deprecated
public GeoPointMetaData inverseWithElevation(float x,
                                                         float y)
        Deprecated. See MapRenderer2#inverse(PointD, GeoPoint, MapRenderer2.InverseMode, int, MapRenderer2.DisplayOrigin) and ElevationManager#getElevation(double, double, ElevationManager.QueryParameters, GeoPointMetaData)
        Computes the corresponding geodetic coordinate for the specified screen coordinate with the addition of looking up the elevation data.
        Parameters:
        x - the x value for the screen coordinate
        y - the y value for the screen coordinate

      • setSelfMarker

        public void setSelfMarker(Marker m)
        Method called by LocationMapComponent to register the self marker with the rest of the system. Once the self marker is initialized, it will not be possible to reinitialize it or set it to another value.
        Parameters:
        m - the self marker.

      • getSelfMarker

        Returns:
        the self marker for the system.

      • getPointWithElevation

        public GeoPointMetaData getPointWithElevation()
        Obtains the centerpoint of the MapView with the associated Elevation.
        Returns:
        the center point of the map with the best available DTED elevation for the altitude/elevation.

public GeoBounds createHitbox(GeoPoint center,
                                          double radius)
        Deprecated. No longer efficient with perspective camera rendering Utilize screen point data from the GL thread where possible
        Create a hit box for detecting touch events
        Parameters:
        center - Center point of hit box
        radius - Inner radius of hit box in pixels
        Returns:
        GeoBounds hit box

      • getMinMapTilt

        public double getMinMapTilt()
        At any given zoom level, there may be a point in which there is a minimal tilt level. Currently will just return 0.
        Returns:
        the minimum tilt level.

      • getMinMapTilt

        public double getMinMapTilt(double mapScale)
        At any given zoom level, there may be a point in which there is a minimal tilt level. Currently will just return 0.
        Parameters:
        mapScale - for which to return the value for the mininum map tilt level.
        Returns:
        the minimum tilt level for the provided mapScale

      • getMaxMapTilt

        public double getMaxMapTilt()
        Returns the maximum allowed tilt level for the system.
        Returns:
        a double representing the maximum tilt for the system.

      • getMaxMapTilt

        public double getMaxMapTilt(double mapScale)
        Returns the maximum allowed tilt level for the system at a specific map scale.
        Returns:
        a double representing the maximum tilt for the current scale value not exceeding the current maximum tilt for the system.
